result.execSummary:
The defendant Kory L. Deacy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Civil Judgment for Restitution with attachment
Def's JU,NEJ,NOC to Langlade Co Jail

Court calls 15CF146, 17CM73, 17CM60 & 17CM59  @ 2:57 pm. Defendant Kory L. Deacy in court, in custody with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF146 SAR, other files plea & sentencing.  State has receive revocation summary packet, no corrections. Atty Seifert  has receive revocation summary packet, no corrections. State gives plea agreement 15CF146, jointly Ct's 2 & 3 6 months jail, 74 days credit, 17CM73 DRI, 17CM60 plea to charge, withheld sentence 17CM59 plea to charge, 6 months jail, concurrent but consecutive to any sentence serving, stayed 2 years probation, costs, Restitution 44.97 in 17CM73, 17CM60 Rest 138, 17CM59 Rest 250.38. Counseling deemed by agent.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understands charges and penalties. 17CM59 Guilty plea, 17CM60 no contest plea, DRI 17CM73. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Def. admits prior convictions.  Atty Seifert is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Theft, repeater in 17CM59 & 17CM60. State gives sentencing recommendation.  State has complied with victim rights. Atty Seifert gives statement.  Def. makes statement.  Court orders on 
15CF146 Ct 2 & 3  6 months jail, 74 days credit, concurrent with each other. Court costs converted to civil judgment.
17CM59 imposed 6 months jail,  consecutive 15CF146, stayed 2 years probation, costs, 200 DNA Surcharge, Restitution17CM73 44.97, 17CM60 138, 17CM59 250.38, Counseling deemed by agent
17CM60 imposed 6 months jail, concurrent to each other but  consecutive 15CF146, stayed 2 years probation, costs, 200 DNA Surcharge Counseling deemed by agent, Huber privileges on all sentence. DNA sampled already provided. No credit on 17CM59 & 17CM60.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 4, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kory L. Deacy in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Defendant Kory L. Deacy in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF146, 15CF171, 15CF242, 16CF13 & 16CM46 @ 3:22 p.m. 16CM46 - copy of complaint received, reading waived, will be dismissed and read in as part of total agreement. $109.82 restitution joint & several to be read in. Written summary of agreement filed. Def has reviewed with atty and wishes to proceed. Plea quest. reviewed. 15CF146 - ct 1 will be dismissed, no prelim waiver needed. Plea to ct 2 - guilty. Plea to ct 3 - no contest. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 1. 15CF171 - Plea to ct 2 - guilty. Plea to ct 3 - guilty. Plea to ct 4 - guilty. Court grants motion to dismiss ct 1 without prejudice. 15CF242 Plea to ct 1 - guilty. Plea to ct 4 - guilty. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in cts 2, 3 & 5. 16CF13 Plea to ct 1 - guilty. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in cts 2 & 3. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 16CM46. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Bayne-Allison satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CF146 ct 2 and ct 3, 15CF171 cts 2, 3, and 4, 15CF242 cts 1 and 4, 16CF13 ct 1. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. State has complied with VWNR. Off the record 3:52. Back on the record 3:54. Discussion off the record regarding credit for time served. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. 15CF146 on cts 2 & 3  - sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, restitution - State has 60 days to determine, reserve right to rest. hrg. Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Credit for 2 days served if revoked. 15CF171 cts 2, 3, & 4 - sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation on each, restitutiton $49.94, Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, 30 days jail on each ct, concurrent to each other but consecutive to any other ordered. Credit for 1 day served if revoked. 15CF242 ct 1 & 4 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation on each, concurrent, restitution $612.70, court costs, DNA surcharges, counseling as required, 45 days jail on each ct, concurrent to each other but consecutive to 15CF171. 16CF13 ct 1 - 6 yrs prison, imposed & stayed, 3 yrs initial, 3 yrs ext supv., 2 yrs probation, concurrent. Court explains reason for sentence. Conditions of probation, restitution $9.94, court costs, DNA surcharge, 60 days jail, consecutive to 15CF171 and 15CF242. 16CM46 - $109.82 restitution, joint & several.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Huber as allowed by jail. Sentence starts today. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Kory L. Deacy in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF242, 16CF13, 15CF171 and 15CF146 @ 10:36 a.m. 15CF146 - State will not file information today. Prelim hrgs will be waived in other 3 cases and all set for plea/sentencing. 15CF242 and 16CF13 - copies of complaints received and Atty Bayne-Allison has reviewed with Def. Def waives prelim hrgs, in 15CF242, 16CF13 and 15CF171. Court reviews waivers with Defendant. Court accepts waivers as knowing & voluntary, finds probable cause and binds over each. Informations filed. Copies received, reading waived, 15CF171 not guilty pleas, Court accepts and directs entry. 15CF242 - Copy received, reading waived, not guilty pleas to each ct. Court accepts pleas and directs entry. 16CF13 - copy of information received, reading waived, not guilty pleas to all cts. Court receives and directs entry of pleas.  15CF146 - State asks Def to clarify that time limits continue to be waived. Atty Bayne-Allison agrees. Def agrees. Bond remains.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kory L. Deacy in court via video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Kory L. Deacy in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 15CF146 & 15CF171.  Statement by Atty Schuster in regards to status of this case.  Request bond be reistated.  Response by state. Statement by def.  Def updates phone number and address on record.  State request warrants be vacated and reinstate bond.  Court will vacate warrants and will reinstate bond.  125CF146 signature bond with conditions.  15CF171 signature bond with conditions.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kory L. Deacy not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 15CF146 & 15CF171  @ 9:50 am. Def. didn't appear for Pre trial on Monday @ 3:30 pm.  State request warrant, Court authorize warrant body only on each case.
